titleStmt.title: James J. Ross to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7188

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of Kentucky

The petitioner states that judgt was rendered against him in the Grant Circuit Court at the Oct Term 1865 for selling liquer to James Gouge a young man under twenty one years of age ^for the sum of Forty Dollars & Costs^ -- He states that said James Gouge came and informed the petitioner that his father authorised him to buy a small quantity of whiskey one pint to be taken to a brother-in laws house -- The petitioner confideing in the statement sold the liquor, he being a tavern Keeper at the time -- He asks the Governor to remit the fine
Sworn to by Jas J Ross before me Oct 25th 1865
N. H. Jeffers C, G, C, C,
The undersigned ask the remission of the above fine

Th N Lindsey
J. OHara jr
J M Collins --
J J Landram
